availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Morgan County, Kentucky, circuit clerk and soldier. Morgan County native. Son of John Mynheir and Sallie McKenzie Mynheir. Farmer in Morgan County in 1850. Elected Sheriff of Morgan County in 1852. Clerk of Morgan Circuit Court in Morgan County from 1860 to 1861. Captain and major in the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Mounted Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) from 1861 to 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, District 1, p. 109. Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 111.
“Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1861,” in 1862 Kentucky Documents, Legislative Document No. 1. (Frankfort, Ky.: Jno. B. Major, State Printer, 1862), 303-308.
Mt. Sterling Advocate (Mount Sterling, Ky.), July 26, 1892, p. 7.
Find A Grave, "William Harrison ‘Bill’ Mynheir (1831-1892)," Memorial #48401541, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/48401541/william-harrison-mynhier# (accessed on July 31, 2018).
